meanings.definition: A long piece of cloth worn around the neck or head for warmth or decoration.
meanings.sent1: She wrapped a colorful scarf around her neck to stay warm.
meanings.sent2: During winter, people often wear a scarf to protect themselves from the cold.
meanings.sent3: The scarf danced in the wind as if it had a life of its own.
meanings.sent4: Her scarf of memories kept her warm on lonely nights.
meanings.sent5: The scarf, like a rainbow, added a touch of magic to her outfit.

meanings.definition: To eat or drink quickly or greedily.
meanings.sent1: He had to scarf down his breakfast before rushing to work.
meanings.sent2: The kids always scarf their snacks after school.
meanings.sent3: She tried to scarf down the hot soup but ended up burning her tongue.
meanings.sent4: The team scarfed down the pizza after the game, hungry from all the running.
meanings.sent5: The raccoon managed to scarf the berries before the birds could get to them.
